intro: Cynoglossum officinale var. humile, commonly known as lesser forget-me-not, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a common sight in woodland areas. Its flowers are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value. The species is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine.
